content-artist: Marshall Bruce Mathers III, known as Eminem, was born October 17, 1972 in Saint Joseph, Missouri. He is an American rapper, producer, actor and label founder. He has sold more than 227.5 million records in the United States alone, making him one of the best-selling artists. He is also the artist who sold the most albums in the United States during the 21st century. He has more than 600 awards, including 15 Grammy Awards and an Oscar.
content-titre: The song “Lose Yourself”, featured on the soundtrack of the film 8 Mile, will allow Eminem to win two Grammy Awards including the first Best Rap Song of the Year 2004. He will also receive his one and only Oscar for best original song.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/5g1vtHqi9uV7xtYeCcFOBx?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Kanye Omari West, who has been calling himself Ye since October 2021, was born on June 8, 1977 in Atlanta. He is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, art director and designer from Chicago. It is a major seller of records in the music industry, with more than 32 million copies sold and 100 million downloads worldwide. He is also one of the most awarded artists in the United States of America, winning 22 Grammy Awards, making him one of the artists with the most victories, and the youngest with such a large track record. Ye West regularly changed his style during his career, moving from so-called gangsta rap, with a baroque influence, to experimental music with a background of electronic music.
content-titre: His song “Jesus Walks”, taken from his first studio album The College Dropout, received the Grammy Award for Best Rap Song of the Year and the album received the title of Best Rap Album of the Year 2005.

content-artist: Kanye Omari West, who has been calling himself Ye since October 2021, was born on June 8, 1977 in Atlanta. He is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, art director and designer from Chicago. It is a major seller of records in the music industry, with more than 32 million copies sold and 100 million downloads worldwide. He is also one of the most awarded artists in the United States of America, winning 22 Grammy Awards, making him one of the artists with the most victories, and the youngest with such a large track record. Ye West regularly changed his style during his career, moving from so-called gangsta rap, with a baroque influence, to experimental music with a background of electronic music.
content-titre: His song “Diamonds from Sierra Leone”, from his second studio album, Late Registration (2005), was produced by West, Jon Brion, and Devo Springsteen. And received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2006.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/2JpUkUR0OsOlUUfm6iS8ic?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Christopher Brian Bridges, born on September 11, 1977, known professionally as Ludacris, is an American rapper and actor. Throughout his career, Ludacris scored two number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100 as a lead artist, “Stand Up” (featuring Shawnna) and “Money Maker” (featuring Pharrell), in addition to three chart-toppers as a featuring act, on Usher's “Yeah!”, Fergie's “Glamorous” and Taio Cruz's “Break Your Heart”. In 2010, he was featured on Justin Bieber's single “Baby”, which became one of the highest-certified singles of all time in the US and a defining song in modern-day popular music.
content-titre: His song “Money Makers”, featuring fellow American rapper and singer Pharrell Williams, was released on July 17, 2006 as the first single from Ludacris's fifth album Release Therapy. Produced by Williams and Chad Hugo, the song received the Grammy Award of the Best Rap Song of the Year 2007.

content-artist: Kanye Omari West, who has been calling himself Ye since October 2021, was born on June 8, 1977 in Atlanta. He is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, art director and designer from Chicago. It is a major seller of records in the music industry, with more than 32 million copies sold and 100 million downloads worldwide. He is also one of the most awarded artists in the United States of America, winning 22 Grammy Awards, making him one of the artists with the most victories, and the youngest with such a large track record. Ye West regularly changed his style during his career, moving from so-called gangsta rap, with a baroque influence, to experimental music with a background of electronic music.
content-titre: His song “Good Life” from his third studio album, Graduation (2007), featured the singer T-Pain. The song includes background vocals from John Legend and Ne-Yo. West and Toomp handled the production, with additional production from Mike Dean. It received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2008.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/5jnxxpX2834SB6LJ0S73Uz?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Dwayne Michael Carter Jr., born on September 27, 1982, known professionally as Lil Wayne, is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. He is regarded as one of the most influential hip hop artists of his generation, and is often cited as one of the greatest rappers of all time. Wayne has sold over 200 million records worldwide, including more than 25 million albums and 92 million digital tracks in the United States, making him one of the world's best-selling music artists. He has won five Grammy Awards, eleven BET Awards, four Billboard Music Awards, two MTV Video Music Awards and eight NAACP Image Awards.
content-titre: His hit “Lollipop”, issued on March 13, 2008, as the lead single from his sixth studio album, Tha Carter III (2008), features vocals from American singer Static Major. The track, which heavily utilizes the Auto-Tune vocal effect, was produced by American record producers Deezle and Jim Jonsin. And it received the Grammy Award for the Best Rap Song of the Year 2009.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/7LR85XLWw2yXqKBSI5brbG?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Shawn Corey Carter, born on December 4, 1969, known professionally as Jay-Z, is an American rapper, record producer, and entrepreneur. Famous for his involvement in the creative and commercial success of numerous artists, he was named the greatest rapper of all time by Billboard and Vibe in 2023. He is the founder and chairman of entertainment company Roc Nation, and was the president and chief executive officer of Def Jam Recordings from 2004 to 2007.
content-titre: His song “Run This Town” featuring Barbadian singer Rihanna and fellow American rapper Kanye West. It was written by the artists alongside Athanasios Alatas, Jeff Bhasker, and No I.D. And received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2010.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/2igwFfvr1OAGX9SKDCPBwO?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Shawn Corey Carter, born on December 4, 1969, known professionally as Jay-Z, is an American rapper, record producer, and entrepreneur. Famous for his involvement in the creative and commercial success of numerous artists, he was named the greatest rapper of all time by Billboard and Vibe in 2023. He is the founder and chairman of entertainment company Roc Nation, and was the president and chief executive officer of Def Jam Recordings from 2004 to 2007.
content-titre: His song “Empire State of Mind” featuring the American singer Alicia Keys, was from the former's 11th studio album, The Blueprint 3 (2009). Produced by Al Shux, the song features a music sample of “Love on a Two-Way Street” performed by The Moments. It was originally written by Angela Hunte and Janet Sewell-Ulepic as a tribute to their hometown, New York City. It received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2011.

artiste: Kanye West, Rihanna, Kid Cudi and Fergie
frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/22L7bfCiAkJo5xGSQgmiIO?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Kanye Omari West, who has been calling himself Ye since October 2021, was born on June 8, 1977 in Atlanta. He is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, art director and designer from Chicago. It is a major seller of records in the music industry, with more than 32 million copies sold and 100 million downloads worldwide. He is also one of the most awarded artists in the United States of America, winning 22 Grammy Awards, making him one of the artists with the most victories, and the youngest with such a large track record. Ye West regularly changed his style during his career, moving from so-called gangsta rap, with a baroque influence, to experimental music with a background of electronic music.
content-titre: His song “All of the Lights” was released as the fourth single from his fifth studio album, My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy (2010). It was produced by West and features additional vocals from several other recording artists, including Drake, John Legend, The-Dream, Alicia Keys, Fergie, Elton John, Ryan Leslie, Charlie Wilson, Tony Williams, La Roux, Alvin Fields, Ken Lewis, Kid Cudi, and Rihanna, with the latter two being credited on the official music video and the official single, but not on the album version of the song. And it received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2012.

content-artist: Kanye Omari West, who has been calling himself Ye since October 2021, was born on June 8, 1977 in Atlanta. He is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, art director and designer from Chicago. It is a major seller of records in the music industry, with more than 32 million copies sold and 100 million downloads worldwide. He is also one of the most awarded artists in the United States of America, winning 22 Grammy Awards, making him one of the artists with the most victories, and the youngest with such a large track record. Ye West regularly changed his style during his career, moving from so-called gangsta rap, with a baroque influence, to experimental music with a background of electronic music.
content-titre: His song “Niggas in Paris” was created in a collaboration with Kanye West from their collaborative album Watch the Throne (2011). The song is built around a synth bell loop from the Dirty South Bangaz music library, and contains vocal samples from “Baptizing Scene” by Reverend W.A. Donaldson, an interpolation of “Victory” by Puff Daddy featuring The Notorious B.I.G. and Busta Rhymes, and dialogue excerpts from the 2007 film Blades of Glory. The song received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2013.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/7bYZBVrnRfqeaPbhRyEvK3?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Macklemore & Ryan Lewis were an American hip hop duo from Seattle, Washington, formed in 2009 by Macklemore, a rapper, and Ryan Lewis, a DJ and record producer. Macklemore and Lewis' single “Thrift Shop” reached number one on the US Billboard Hot 100 in 2013. The single was soon dubbed the first song since 1994 to top the Hot 100 chart without the support of a major record label by Billboard.
content-titre: Their song “Thrift Shop” was made with vocals from American singer Wanz. It was released in 2012, as the fourth single from the former's debut studio album, The Heist (2012). It received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2014.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/7wdzLe2Gsx1RGqbvYZHASz?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Kendrick Lamar Duckworth, born on June 17, 1987, is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. Known as “King Kendrick”, he is widely regarded as one of the most influential rappers of his generation. His works, which regularly infuse social, political, religious, and philosophical influences, became a catalyst in the rise of social consciousness amongst Millennials. Lamar has been named the second-greatest rapper of all time by Billboard and Vibe, and has garnered critical acclaim for his signature cadences, artistic reinventions, and introspective songwriting.
content-titre: His song “i” was featured with Ronald Isley of The Isley Brothers. It was released on September 23, 2014 as the lead single from Lamar's third studio album To Pimp a Butterfly. The song uses music from “That Lady”, written by and originally performed by R&B group The Isley Brothers, elements from which were re-recorded rather than being directly sampled from the original record. The song received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2015.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/3iVcZ5G6tvkXZkZKlMpIUs?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Kendrick Lamar Duckworth, born on June 17, 1987, is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. Known as “King Kendrick”, he is widely regarded as one of the most influential rappers of his generation. His works, which regularly infuse social, political, religious, and philosophical influences, became a catalyst in the rise of social consciousness amongst Millennials. Lamar has been named the second-greatest rapper of all time by Billboard and Vibe, and has garnered critical acclaim for his signature cadences, artistic reinventions, and introspective songwriting.
content-titre: His song “Alright” featured on the artist's third studio album, To Pimp a Butterfly (2015) was released to radio stations as the album's fourth single on June 30, 2015. The song expresses ideas of hope amid personal struggles and features uncredited vocals in its chorus from co-producer Pharrell Williams. It received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2016.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/0wwPcA6wtMf6HUMpIRdeP7?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Aubrey Drake Graham, born on October 24, 1986, is a Canadian rapper and singer. An influential figure in contemporary popular music, Drake has been credited for popularizing singing and R&B sensibilities in hip hop. Among the world's best-selling music artists, with over 170 million records sold, Drake is ranked as the highest-certified digital singles artist in the United States by the RIAA. He has won five Grammy Awards, six American Music Awards, a record 34 Billboard Music Awards, two Brit Awards, and three Juno Awards.
content-titre: His song “Hotline Bling” serves as the lead single from his fourth studio album Views (2016). The song is credited as a bonus track on the album. It was made available for digital download on July 31, 2015, through Cash Money, Young Money and Republic. And it received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2017.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/7KXjTSCq5nL1LoYtL7XAwS?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Kendrick Lamar Duckworth, born on June 17, 1987, is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. Known as “King Kendrick”, he is widely regarded as one of the most influential rappers of his generation. His works, which regularly infuse social, political, religious, and philosophical influences, became a catalyst in the rise of social consciousness amongst Millennials. Lamar has been named the second-greatest rapper of all time by Billboard and Vibe, and has garnered critical acclaim for his signature cadences, artistic reinventions, and introspective songwriting.
content-titre: His song “HUMBLE” was released on March 30, 2017, along with its music video, by Top Dawg Entertainment, Aftermath Entertainment and Interscope Records. The song was written by Lamar and producers Mike Will Made It and Pluss. It was provided to rhythmic contemporary radio as the lead single from Lamar's fourth studio album, Damn. And it received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2018.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/6DCZcSspjsKoFjzjrWoCdn?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Aubrey Drake Graham, born on October 24, 1986, is a Canadian rapper and singer. An influential figure in contemporary popular music, Drake has been credited for popularizing singing and R&B sensibilities in hip hop. Among the world's best-selling music artists, with over 170 million records sold, Drake is ranked as the highest-certified digital singles artist in the United States by the RIAA. He has won five Grammy Awards, six American Music Awards, a record 34 Billboard Music Awards, two Brit Awards, and three Juno Awards.
content-titre: His song “God’s Plan” was released on January 19, 2018, through Young Money and Cash Money. The song was written alongside Brock Korsan and producers Cardo, Yung Exclusive, Boi-1da, and Noah “40” Shebib. It acts as the respective lead single from his second EP Scary Hours and fifth studio album Scorpion (both out in 2018). The song received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2019.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/2t8yVaLvJ0RenpXUIAC52d?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Shéyaa Bin Abraham-Joseph, born on 22 October 1992, known professionally as 21 Savage, is an English-born rapper. A British citizen, he has resided in the United States since childhood. 21 Savage was born in London, and moved to Atlanta, Georgia with his mother at age seven. In 2016, he would also gain further recognition for his guest appearance on Drake's single “Sneakin”. He then signed a recording contract with Epic Records in January 2017. His second album, I Am > I Was (2018), became his first U.S. number-one album and spawned the hit song “A Lot” (featuring J. Cole), which won Best Rap Song at the 2020 Grammy Awards.
content-titre: His song “A Lot” was released on December 20, 2018 via the rapper's YouTube account. It was sent to rhythmic and urban contemporary radio on January 8, 2019 as the lead single from his second studio album I Am > I Was. The song was written by the artists and its producers DJ Dahi and J. White Did It. It samples “I Love You” by East of Underground, which is a cover of “I Love You for All Seasons” performed by The Fuzz; The Fuzz member Shelia Young is credited as a co-writer. It received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2020.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/5v4GgrXPMghOnBBLmveLac?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Megan Jovon Ruth Pete, born on February 15, 1995, known professionally as Megan Thee Stallion, is an American rapper. Originally from Houston, Texas, she first garnered attention when videos of her freestyling became popular on social media platforms such as Instagram. She released her debut studio album Good News (2020) to critical acclaim, appearing on several year-end best album lists. She earned her first and second number-one singles on the US Billboard Hot 100 with the remix of her song “Savage” (featuring Beyoncé), and her feature on Cardi B's single “WAP”; the latter of which was her first number one in several other countries.
content-titre: Her song “Savage” featuring Beyoncé was surprise-released on April 29, 2020, and included on Megan's debut album Good News (2020). The remix was written and recorded remotely, by the songwriter The-Dream. And it received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2021.

He is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, art director and designer from Chicago. It is a major seller of records in the music industry, with more than 32 million copies sold and 100 million downloads worldwide. He is also one of the most awarded artists in the United States of America, winning 22 Grammy Awards, making him one of the artists with the most victories, and the youngest with such a large track record. Ye West regularly changed his style during his career, moving from so-called gangsta rap, with a baroque influence, to experimental music with a background of electronic music.
content-titre: His song “Jail” from his tenth studio album, Donda (2021), includes vocals from fellow American rapper Jay-Z. Towards the end of the album, another version of the song titled “Jail pt 2” appears, which includes more vocals from DaBaby and Marilyn Manson. The song received the Best Rap Song of the Year 2022.

frame: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/5MMW4CZsZiZt2iuqAXzzWC?utm_source=generator&theme=0" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
content-artist: Kendrick Lamar Duckworth, born on June 17, 1987, is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. Known as “King Kendrick”, he is widely regarded as one of the most influential rappers of his generation. His works, which regularly infuse social, political, religious, and philosophical influences, became a catalyst in the rise of social consciousness amongst Millennials. Lamar has been named the second-greatest rapper of all time by Billboard and Vibe, and has garnered critical acclaim for his signature cadences, artistic reinventions, and introspective songwriting.
content-titre: His song “The Heart Part 5” was released as a surprise on May 8, 2022, through pgLang, Top Dawg Entertainment, Aftermath Entertainment and Interscope Records. It was a promotional single to help anticipate the release for Lamar's fifth studio album Mr. Morale & the Big Steppers, where it was later included as a streaming bonus track. It is the fifth part in his “The Heart” song series following “The Heart Part 4” in 2017, and his first solo release in over four years. And it received the Best Rap Song and the Best Rap Performance of the Year 2023.
